revised_title: Effect of Conductors on the Rate of Propagation of Electrical Disturbances
tldr: The author investigates the effect of conductors on the rate of propagation of electrical disturbances along a wire, considering the capacity of the wire and its surrounding environment. They demonstrate that the velocity of propagation does not depend on the specific resistance of the wire and increases with the rapidity of the electrical oscillations. This study helps to explain the differences in propagation rates observed by previous researchers and provides a means to test the validity of Maxwell's theory.
